original: Abrahamson, Leopold Adolf, tandläkare, Norrköping, f. 17/3/86 i Linköping av grosshandl. Leon. A. o. Rosa Levin. — Mog:ex. i Linköping 04, tandl:kand. 05, tandläkare 08. Tjg. v. Garn:sjukh. i Sthlm tandpoUkhn. sommaren 07, praktik i Ystad 08-16, i Norrköping sed. 16, tandl. v. folksk. tandpoliklin. där 17-19, v. militärsk. där 21-22 samt v. Bergs kommuns folksk. sed. 22. Studrresor t. Mar-burg an der Lahn 12, t. käkstationerna i BerHn, Düsseldorf o. Altona 15.
translated: Abrahamson, Leopold Adolf, dentist, from Norrköping, born March 17, 1886 in Linköping to the merchants Leon A. and Rosa Levin. He completed his secondary education in Linköping in 1904, graduated in dentistry in 1905, and became a practicing dentist in 1908. He served at the military hospital in Stockholm as a dental assistant during the summer of 1907 and practiced in Ystad from 1908 to 1916, before moving to Norrköping. He worked as a dentist at the local school dental clinic from 1917 to 1919, at the military school from 1921 to 1922, and at the Bergs municipality school from 1922 onwards. He undertook study trips to Marburg an der Lahn in 1912 and to jaw stations in Berlin, Düsseldorf, and Altona in 1915.

structured.name: Leopold Adolf Abrahamson

workHistory.title: Dentist at Local School Dental Clinic

structured.description: Leopold Adolf Abrahamson was a Swedish dentist born on March 17, 1886 in Linköping to the merchants Leon A. and Rosa Levin. He completed his secondary education in Linköping in 1904, graduated in dentistry in 1905, and became a practicing dentist in 1908. He served at the military hospital in Stockholm as a dental assistant during the summer of 1907 and practiced in Ystad from 1908 to 1916 before moving to Norrköping. He worked as a dentist at the local school dental clinic from 1917 to 1919, at the military school from 1921 to 1922, and at the Bergs municipality school from 1922 onwards. He undertook study trips to Marburg an der Lahn in 1912 and to jaw stations in Berlin, Düsseldorf, and Altona in 1915.
